description:
Role Purpose

With the departure of the digital performance analyst, the marketing department requires a backfill of the position, and at the same time, expand the remit of the analytics role in alignment with the FY24 strategy and forward.

This individual will play a crucial role in measuring, reporting, and analysing end-to-end marketing funnel performance, which is essential for optimizing marketing campaigns and maximising return on investment (ROI). The role will require the candidate to work closely with marketing functional leaders and channel owners to ensure optimal marketing performance. By approving the role, the business will benefit from a more data-driven approach to marketing, leading to enhanced campaign performance, better allocation of resources, and ultimately, higher revenue generation.

Benefits:
• Improved marketing performance and ROI due to data-driven decision-making.
• Efficient allocation of marketing budget, leading to cost savings.
• Enhanced marketing campaign effectiveness and targeting.
• Identification of new growth opportunities and market trends.
• Improved collaboration and communication within the marketing department.
• Competitive advantage through industry benchmarking and best practices.

Responsibilities
• Measure, report and analyse end-to-end marketing funnel performance across marketing channels, products, and other performance segments
• Work with marketing functional leaders and channel owners (lines of business, corporate programs, digital, social media, and PR etc.) to measure campaign performance
• Develop and manage marketing analytics dashboards to provide internal business and marketing stakeholder real-time insights on marketing performance
• Own monthly, quarterly and annual Marketing KPI reports, spend time with marketing stakeholder to ensuring these reports meet the teams’ evolving reporting needs
• Develop and enhance funnel forecast and budgeting framework for all customer acquisition channels including both online digital and offline media
• Benchmark digital and funnel performance against industry best practices with recommendations to improve key metrics
• Draw insights and recommendations from analysis and present recommendation to internal stakeholders with the objective to improve marketing performance and ROI
• Manage and report on marketing campaign tracking, including sources across multiple channels like web, social, email, live events, webinars, and online communities.
• Provide data insights ranging from click attribution to media mix modelling to optimize marketing campaigns on various digital channels
• Correlate digital analytics with CRM data to ensure coherent interpretation and analysis of a lead (to opportunity) journey
• Identify analytics solutions and develop roadmap to enhance analytics capabilities

Skills and Experience
• 5 years of marketing analytics, marketing operations, or digital marketing experience, preferably in a related industry
• Ability to track, measure, and report on results of various marketing functions to determine ROI
• Advanced in data segmentation and reporting within a CRM and Marketing Automation system (Salesforce and Pardot are highly preferred)
• Excellent analytical skills and ability to provide actionable insights from data
• Advanced in Microsoft Excel
• Solid understanding of the marketing funnel and sales cycle
• Experience with data visualization tools (PowerBI and Looker Studio highly preferred)
• Experience in Google Analytics, Google Ads, Google Search Console, Looker Studio, Google Tag Manager and GA Connector
• Skilled in problem solving and project management
• Self-starter with a history of pushing for deadline-driven results
• Strong communication skills

Behaviour:
• Ambitious - Drive, Planning & Execution
• Adventurous - Flexibility & Resilience and Savvy Thinking
• Community - Collaboration & Communication
